result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Re: Oral Motion for Reverse Waiver 9-9-22 22CF2410

Case in court for Scheduling Conference.

Discussions held.

Case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing December 1, 2022 at 1:30pm in Branch 32 IN PERSON.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert D Johnson
Current: 7762 Mountain Stream Way, Indianapolis, IN 46239 United States  (Effective: 06-21-2022)
Prior: 1309 South 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Robert D Johnson in court.  Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court for Robert D Johnson.  Assistant District Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-CCAP warrant cancelled.   The Court vacated the bench warrant.   Initial Appearance proceeded.  Bail hearing proceeded.  Statements made by parties.  The Court set provisional bail at $100,000.00 P R Bond with Turn Over To Justice Point for Level 1 or 2 court reminders.  Defendant to appear for all future court dates.   Due to serious medical needs the PR Bond is appropriate at this time and could be revisited at a later date.  Defense requests preliminary hearing and reverse waiver proceeding.  Court sets zoom status before Judge Laura Gramling-Perez Br 32.  mn

Initial appearance on September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
